page.topic: UX Component - List Controls - onClick Event - List Headers and Footers
page.description: If you have defined a header or a footer for List control, and you have also defined an onClick event, you will notice that the onClick event fires when you click on either the header or the footer.

section.description: In your application, this might not be desirable. If so, then you can use the onTap event, rather than the onClick event, or alternative, in the onClick event, you can test what row index the user clicked on.
